Description: Sherd, mended from six fragments, of ring foot and lower wall of East Greek pottery plate or bowl; interior slipped cream: head and mane of lion to right drawn in outline; rosettes as fill. Exterior: two bands on wall; lowest wall and outside of foot glazed.
Curator's comments: An unusual piece, seemingly with large lion protome. Compare 1926,1117,1.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.943)
